scope: Local AI-assisted Vim development environment using Docker and Ollama without exposing host filesystem
initial_goal: Create a containerized Vim environment with local AI coding assistance, fully isolated from host filesystem, suitable for portfolio use
key_decisions: Abandoned vim-ai due to OpenAI-centric design and API key assumptions
Switched to vim-ollama for native Ollama support
Avoided GPU usage due to legacy NVIDIA GM108M
Explicitly limited RAM and model size for laptop safety
major_issues_encountered: Mismatch between Vim embedded Python and system Python paths
resolutions: Validated Ollama REST API via /api endpoints
Installed Python dependencies via apt and pip
Identified vim-ollama execution model limitations in containers

current_state.remaining_risk: vim-ollama Python environment coupling in minimal containers
current_state.recommended_future_step: Switch to Neovim or rebuild Vim against system Python for full stability

portfolio_guidance.positioning: Human-in-the-loop AI assistance, not autonomous generation
